document.docAuthor: Malta Borges, Leandro, Paladini, Andressa & Bertani, Rogério
document.masterDocTitle: Two new species of Eupalaestrus Pocock, 1901 (Araneae: Theraphosidae) from Southern Brazil and Northeastern Argentina

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new species of Eupalaestrus Pocock, 1901 (Araneae: Theraphosidae) from Southern Brazil and Northeastern Argentina

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis (emended from Bertani 2001 ).
Eupalaestrus
males differ from those of all other theraphosine genera by the presence of a denticulate row on the subapical area of the male palpal bulb embolus in conjunction with the lack of stridulatory setae on the palpus trochanter. Females differ from those of all other theraphosines, except
Proshapalopus amazonicus
and
Vitalius lucasae
, by having the tibia IV thickened, in conjunction with scopula on the retrolateral face of femur IV and the absence of stridulatory setae on the retrolateral face of the trochanter of the palpus. They differ from
P. amazonicus
and
V. lucasae
by the presence of urticating setae III (most species) or by the presence of stiff setae on metatarsus IV (
E. spinosissimus
).

Species included .
Eupalaestrus campestratus , Eupalaestrus crassimetatarsis
sp. nov. ,
Eupalaestrus larae , Eupalaestrus roccoi
sp. nov. ,
Eupalaestrus spinosissimus
and
Eupalaestrus weijenberghi .

Other material examined .
